de.weltraumschaf.ebnf.parser
Class EbnfScanner

java.lang.Object
  de.weltraumschaf.ebnf.parser.EbnfScanner
All Implemented Interfaces:
Scanner
public class EbnfScanner
extends Object
implements Scanner

Scans an input string for EBNF syntax tokens. This class implements a standard lexical scanner pattern with one character lookahead and iterator interface for receiving token by token. On lexical syntax errors a SyntaxException will be thrown. Example: BufferedReader grammar = new BufferedReader(new StringReader("...")); // the EBNF grammar try { Scanner scanner = new Scanner(grammar); while (scanner->hasNextToken()) { scanner->nextToken(); Token token = scanner->currentToken(); doSomething(token); } } catch (SyntaxtError ex) { logError(ex); }

Author:
Sven Strittmatter

hasNextToken

public boolean hasNextToken()
Returns if there are more tokens. This is always true if never Scanner.nextToken() was called. No more tokens are indicated if the current token is of type TokenType.EOF.

Specified by:
hasNextToken in interface Scanner
Returns:

peekToken

public Token peekToken()
                throws SyntaxException,
                       IOException
Returns the next token without advancing the internal pointer (aka. lookahead). A call to Scanner.nextToken() will return this token ahead.

Specified by:
peekToken in interface Scanner
Returns:
Throws:
SyntaxException - On syntax errors.
IOException - On input stream IO errors.

nextToken

public void nextToken()
               throws SyntaxException,
                      IOException
Start the scanning of the next token. This method should be called until {hasNextToken()} returns false.
